skill.name: treatment-plans
skill.description: Generate concise (3-4 page), focused medical treatment plans in LaTeX/PDF format for all clinical specialties. Supports general medical treatment, rehabilitation therapy, mental health care, chronic disease management, perioperative care, and pain management. Includes SMART goal frameworks, evidence-based interventions with minimal text citations, regulatory compliance (HIPAA), and professional formatting. Prioritizes brevity and clinical actionability.

security_audit.summary: This is a medical documentation template skill with no security risks. All 510 static findings are false positives: LaTeX macro commands (newcommand, ProvidesPackage) are misidentified as cryptographic algorithms; medical terminology (patient monitoring, vital signs) is misidentified as system reconnaissance; markdown code blocks are misidentified as shell execution. The skill only performs template file operations and text parsing. No network calls, no credential access, no external command execution beyond documentation examples.

content.value_statement: Medical professionals need structured, compliant treatment plans for patient care documentation. This skill provides professional LaTeX templates, validation scripts, and clinical frameworks for generating treatment plans across all medical specialties in minutes.
actual_capabilities: Generate 7 types of treatment plan templates (general medical, rehabilitation, mental health, chronic disease, perioperative, pain management, one-page format)
Validate treatment plans for completeness and quality compliance using automated scripts
Create visual treatment timelines from plan content
Apply SMART goal frameworks and evidence-based intervention guidelines
limitations: Requires LaTeX distribution to compile PDF output
Does not provide medical advice or clinical decision support
Templates require manual customization with patient-specific information
Does not integrate with electronic health record (EHR) systems

use_cases.title: Chronic Disease Management
use_cases.description: Create structured diabetes, hypertension, or heart failure treatment plans with evidence-based goals.

use_cases.title: Rehabilitation Program Design
use_cases.description: Develop post-stroke, orthopedic, or cardiac rehabilitation plans with functional goals.

use_cases.title: Mental Health Treatment Planning
use_cases.description: Generate psychiatric treatment plans with CBT protocols, medication regimens, and safety planning.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Diabetes Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a general medical treatment plan for a 58-year-old patient with Type 2 diabetes, HbA1c 8.5%, using the general_medical template. Include metformin titration schedule and lifestyle modification goals.

prompt_templates.title: Stroke Rehab Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a rehabilitation treatment plan for a 70-year-old patient post-left MCA stroke with right hemiparesis. Include PT goals for ambulation and OT goals for ADL independence within 12 weeks.

prompt_templates.title: Mental Health Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a mental health treatment plan for a 35-year-old with moderate depression, PHQ-9 score 16. Include sertraline titration, weekly CBT sessions, and safety planning.

prompt_templates.title: Surgical Care Pathway
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a perioperative care plan for a 68-year-old patient scheduled for right total knee arthroplasty. Include ERAS protocol, pain management, and discharge planning milestones.

best_practices: Start with one-page format for straightforward cases and only expand to longer formats when clinical complexity requires it
Always use SMART criteria for goals: Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound
De-identify all patient information per HIPAA Safe Harbor method before sharing documents
anti_patterns: Using verbose academic language instead of concise clinical terminology
Including information that does not directly inform treatment decisions
Failing to document medication rationale, dosing, and monitoring parameters

faq.question: Which template should I use for my clinical scenario?
faq.answer: Choose one_page for quick reference, general_medical for primary care, rehabilitation for PT/OT, mental_health for psychiatric, chronic_disease for complex conditions, perioperative for surgical cases, and pain_management for pain-focused treatment.

faq.question: How long should a treatment plan be?
faq.answer: Default to one-page format (preferred for most cases). Use 3-4 pages for moderate complexity and 5-6 pages only for highly complex multidisciplinary cases.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with my EHR system?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates standalone LaTeX/PDF documents. Export content manually to your EHR if needed.

faq.question: Is patient data safe when using these templates?
faq.answer: Templates are local files. You must manually de-identify patient information per HIPAA guidelines. No data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: What if validation scripts find issues?
faq.answer: Review the specific issues flagged. Common fixes include adding SMART criteria to goals, including ICD-10 codes, and documenting medication monitoring parameters.

faq.question: How does this compare to commercial EHR treatment plan modules?
faq.answer: This provides open-source, customizable templates with full control over formatting. Commercial EHRs offer integration but may limit customization.
